overview: This subject progresses from Animation Lab 2 to investigate, experiment and apply methods of animation production to screens in galleries, public spaces, live performances and contemporary screen contexts.
Students create individual and group devised concepts and examples of works for 'other' screens that are new and emerging screen contexts for animation.
intended learning outcomes: identify new and emerging screen contexts for animation;
plan, develop and manage a projection art production;
critique, evaluate and apply feedback to projection art production and exhibition;
apply creative and technical requirements for projection art;
create animation for new and emerging screen contexts.

assessments.description: 5-minute contemporary screen contexts for animation presentation. 400 words (equivalent)
Animated projection design for exhibition. 800 words (equivalent)

Hurdle requirement:. Students must submit all elements of assessment to be eligible for a pass in this subject. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 75% of all scheduled classes.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 36 hours, comprising one 3-hour workshop per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
